page.title: 01SCORAIG PENINSULA WESTEROSS
page.content: THE SCORAIG PENINSULA IS IN NORTH- WEST SCOTLAND,LYING BETWEEN LOCH BROOM AND LITTLE LOCH BROOM.IT IS AN AREA OF ROUGH MOORLAND AND ROCKY SEA-SHORE.THE CLIMATE IS MILD BECAUSE OF THE GULF STREAM. A SMALL PART OF THE AREA IS TAKEN UP BY THE CROFTING TOWNSHIPS OF SCORAIG,CARNOCH,RHIREVOCH AND ACHMORE. THE CROFTERS KEEP CATTLE,SHEEP,GOATS, PONIES AND POULTRY.THEY HAVE LARGE VEGETABLE GARDENS,BUT THE SMALL AREA OF ARABLE LAND IS USED TO RAISE CROPS FOR THEIR ANIMALS. THOSE WHO ARE NOT CROFTERS MAKE A LIVING BY FISHING,SMALL INDUSTRY AND CRAFTS.THERE ARE ALSO PEOPLE WORKING AS POSTMAN,SCHOOL TEACHER AND CLEANER. ALL THE PEOPLE ARE INCOMERS. THERE IS NO ROAD ACCESS TO SCORAIG. PEOPLE COME AND GO BY BOAT FROM BADLUARACH OR ON FOOT FROM BADRALLACH.
